entry.title: First eigenvalue and Maximum principle for fully nonlinear singular operators
entry.summary: Through the Maximum principle we define the principal eigenvalue for a class of fully-nonlinear operators that are the non-variational equivalent of the p-Laplacian. We also obtain some a priori Holder estimates for non-negative solutions below that eigenvalue.

entry.title: Semi-Classical Wavefront Set and Fourier Integral Operators
entry.summary: We define and prove some properties of the semi-classical wavefront set. We also define and study semi-classical Fourier integral operators, of which we give a complete characterization. Lastly, we prove a generalization of the semi-classical Egorov's Theorem to manifolds of unequal dimensions.

entry.title: Absolutely continuous spectrum of multidimensional Schrodinger operator
entry.summary: We prove that 3-dimensional Schrodinger operator with slowly decaying potential has an absolutely continuous spectrum that fills the positive half-line. The asymptotics of Green's function is obtained as well.

entry.title: On the absence of rapidly decaying solutions for parabolic operators whose coefficients are non-Lipschitz continuous in time
entry.summary: We find minimal regularity conditions on the coefficients of a parabolic operator, ensuring that no nontrivial solution tends to zero faster than any exponential.

entry.title: On Smoothness of $L_{3,\infty}$-Solutions to the Navier-Stokes Equations up to Boundary
entry.summary: We show that $L_{3,\infty}$-solutions to the three-dimensional Navier-Stokes equations near a flat part of the boundary are smooth.

entry.title: Coupling for some partial differential equations driven by white noise
entry.summary: We prove, using coupling arguments, exponential convergence to equilibrium for reaction--diffusion and Burgers equations driven by space-time white noise. We use a coupling by reflection.

entry.title: Weighted L^p decay estimates of solutions to the wave equation with a potential
entry.summary: We obtain large time decay estimates on weighted $L^p$ spaces for solutions to the wave equation with real-valued potential $V(x)=O(|x|^{-2-a})$, $a>0$, for $|x|>1$.

entry.title: Bounds of Riesz Transforms on $L^p$ Spaces for Second Order Elliptic Operators
entry.summary: For any fixed $p>2$, a necessary and sufficient condition is obtained for the boundedness of the Riesz transforms associated with second order elliptic operators with real, symmetric, bounded measurable coefficients.
entry.arxiv:comment: To appear in Annales de L'Institut Fourier (Grenoble)

entry.title: Stable determination of generic simple metrics from the hyperbolic Dirichlet-to-Neumann map
entry.summary: We prove H\"older type stability estimates near generic simple Riemannian metrics for the inverse problem of recovering such metrics from the Dirichlet-to-Neumann map associated to the wave equation for the Laplace-Beltrami operator.

entry.title: A note on Alxesandrov type theorem for k-convex functions
entry.summary: In this note we show that $k$-convex functions on $\Bbb R^n$ are twice differentiable almost everywhere for every positive integer $k>n/2$. This generalizes the classical Alexsandrov's theorem for convex functions.

entry.title: A Toda lattice in dimension 2 and Nevanlinna theory
entry.summary: It is shown how to study the 2-D Toda system for SU(n+1) using Nevanlinna theory of meromorphic functions and holomorphic curves. The results generalize recent results of Jost - Wang and Chen - Li.

entry.title: An example of $\infty$-harmonic function, which is not $C^2$ on a dense subset
entry.summary: We show that for certain boundary values McShane-Whitney's minimal-extension-like function is $\infty$-harmonic near the boundary and is not $C^2$ on a dense subset.

entry.title: Dissipative hydrodynamic models for the diffusion of impurities in a gas
entry.summary: Recently linear dissipative models of the Boltzmann equation have been introduced. In this work, we consider the problem of constructiing suitable hydrodynamic approximations for such models where the mean velocity and the temperature of inelastic particles appear as independent variables.

entry.title: Dispersive estimates for Schroedinger operators: A survey
entry.summary: We present some old and new results on dispersive estimates for Schroedinger equations.
entry.arxiv:comment: In this new version some more references have been added

entry.title: Stable manifolds for all monic supercritical NLS in one dimension
entry.summary: We show that all supercritical monic focusing NLS in one space dimension exhibit asymptotic stability of perturbed standing waves provided the perturbations are chosen on a small hypersuface in a suitable space.

entry.title: The General Quasilinear Ultrahyperbolic Schrödinger Equation
entry.summary: In this work we establish a local existence theory for the initial value problem associated to the general quasi-linear ultrahyperbolic Schr\"odinger equation.

entry.title: Nonuniqueness of weak solutions of the nonlinear Schroedinger equation
entry.summary: Generalized solutions of the Cauchy problem for the one-dimensional periodic nonlinear Schr\"odinger equation, with certain nonlinearities, are not unique. For any $s<0$ there exist nonzero generalized solutions varying continuously in the Sobolev space $H^s$, with identically vanishing initial data.

entry.title: Global Regularity for the Yang-Mills Equations on High Dimensional Minkowski Space
entry.summary: We prove that smallness of the critical Sobolev norm implies regularity for the Yang-Mills equations on (6+1) and higher dimensional Minkowski space.

entry.title: Weighted Decay Estimates for the Wave Equation with Radially Symmetric Data
entry.summary: We study the homogeneous wave equation with radially symmetric data in four or higher space dimensions. Using some new integral representations for the Riemann operator, we establish weighted decay estimates for the solution.

entry.title: On symmetry problems
entry.summary: withdrawn Several symmetry problems are discussed. These include the Pompeiu problem and similar conjectures for the heat and wave equations.

entry.title: Time-global smoothing estimates for a class of dispersive equations with constant coefficients
entry.summary: This paper has been withdrawn by the author due to an error.

entry.title: Finite Time Blow-up for the 3D Incompressible Euler Equations
entry.summary: The paper has been withdrawn by the author due to a gap in Proof of Theorem 1.1.
entry.arxiv:comment: The paper has been withdrawn by the author due to a gap in Proof of Theorem 1.1

entry.title: Symmetry breaking results for problems with exponential growth in the unit disk
entry.summary: We investigate some asymptotic properties of extrema to a two-dimensional variational problem in the unit disk. Some results about non-radialicity of solutions are given.

entry.title: On Davies' conjecture and strong ratio limit properties for the heat kernel
entry.summary: We study strong ratio limit properties and the exact long time asymptotics of the heat kernel of a general second-order parabolic operator which is defined on a noncompact Riemannian manifold.

entry.title: Solutions for Toda systems on Riemann surfaces
entry.summary: In this paper, we study the solutions of Toda systems on Riemann surface in the critical case, we prove a sufficient condition for the existence of solutions of Toda systems.

entry.title: Conformally invariant fully nonlinear elliptic equations and isolated singularities
entry.summary: We study solutions to conformally invariant equations with isolated singularties.

entry.title: Stable determination of the surface impedance of an obstacle by far field measurements
entry.summary: We deal with the inverse scattering problem of determining the surface impedance of a partially coated obstacle. We prove a stability estimate of logarithmic type for the impedance term by the far field measurements.

entry.title: Global well-posedness in the Energy space for the Benjamin-Ono equation on the circle
entry.summary: We prove that the Benjamin-Ono equation is well-posed in $ H^{1/2}(\T) $. This leads to a global well-posedness result in $ H^{1/2}(\T) $ thanks to the energy conservation.

entry.title: Regularity for solutions of the two-phase Stefan problem
entry.summary: We consider local solutions of the two-phase Stefan problem with a "mushy" region. We show that if a (distributional) solution u is locally square integrable then the temperature is continuous.

entry.title: A consequence of a lower bound of the K-energy
entry.summary: We prove that over a Fano manifold having the K-energy of a the canonical class bounded from below, the Chen-Tian energy functional E_1 of the class is allso bounded from below.

entry.title: Integrable Systems and Harmonic Maps into Lie Groups
entry.summary: A study of harmonic maps into Lie groups as a generalisation of the study of other well-known integrable systems, particularly the Toda and self-dual Chern Simons theories.

entry.title: Critical regularity for elliptic equations from Littlewood-Paley theory
entry.summary: Using simple facts from harmonic analysis, namely Bernstein inequality and Plansherel isometry, we prove that the pseudodifferential equation $\Delta^\alpha u+Vu=0$ improves the Sobolev regularity of solutions provided the potential $V$ is integrable with the critical power $n/2\alpha>1$.

entry.title: Dissipative quasi-geostrophic equations with initial data
entry.summary: This paper was withdrawn by arXiv admin because it plagiarizes "Jiahong Wu The two-dimensional quasi-geostrophic equation with critical or supercritical dissipation 2005 Nonlinearity 18 139-154."

entry.title: Nonlinear instability for the Navier-Stokes equations
entry.summary: It is proved, using a bootstrap argument, that linear instability implies nonlinear instability for the incompressible Navier-Stokes equations in $L^p$ for all $p \in (1,\infty)$ and any finite or infinite domain in any dimension $n$.

entry.title: The defocusing energy-critical nonlinear Schrödinger equation in higher dimensions
entry.summary: We obtain global well-posedness, scattering, and global $L^{\frac{2(n+2)}{n-2}}_{t,x}$ spacetime bounds for energy-space solutions to the energy-critical nonlinear Schr\"odinger equation in $\R_t\times \R^n_x$, $n\geq 5$.

entry.title: A priori estimates for solutions of a nonlinear dispersive equation
entry.summary: This paper has been withdrawn by the author due to a crucial error.

entry.title: On existence of minimizers for the Hardy-Sobolev-Maz'ya inequality
entry.summary: We show existence of minimizers for the Hardy-Sobolev-Maz'ya inequality in $R^{m+n}\setminus\R^n$ for $m=1$ and $n>2$ or for $m>2$ and $n>0$.

entry.title: Global well-posedness of the Benjamin-Ono equation in low-regularity spaces
entry.summary: We prove that the Benjamin-Ono initial value problem is globally well-posed in the Sobolev spaces $H^\sigma_r$, $\sigma\geq 0$.

entry.title: A dyadic decomposition approach to a finitely degenerate hyperbolic problem
entry.summary: We use the Littlewood-Paley decomposition technique to obtain a $C^\infty$-well-posedness result for a weakly hyperbolic equation with a finite order of degeneration

entry.title: Spectral Theory and Nonlinear PDE: a Survey
entry.summary: This is a slightly modified version of the survey article. Minor changes to the text and the references have been made.

entry.title: Tangential Touch between Free and Fixed Boundaries in a Problem from Superconductivity
entry.summary: In this paper we study regularity properties of the free boundary problem from superconductivity close to a fixed boundary. If the origin is a free boundary point, then we show that the free boundary touches the fixed boundary tangentially.

entry.title: Strichartz estimates for the magnetic Schrödinger equation
entry.summary: We prove global, scale invariant Strichartz estimates for the linear magnetic Schr\"odinger equation with small time dependent magnetic field. This is done by constructing an appropriate parametrix. As an application, we show a global regularity type result for Schr\"odinger maps in dimensions $n\geq 6$.

entry.title: Hessian equations with elementary symmetric functions
entry.summary: We consider the Dirichlet problem for two types of degenerate elliptic Hessian equations . New results about solvability of the equations in the $C^{1,1}$ space are provided.
entry.arxiv:comment: 22 pages, revised version, accepted by Comm. Partial Differential Equations

entry.title: The $C^{\a}$ regularity of a class of ultraparabolic equations
entry.summary: We prove the $C^{\alpha}$ regularity for weak solutions to a class of ultraparabolic equation, with measurable coefficients. The results generalized our recent $C^{\alpha}$ regularity results of Prandtl's system to high dimensional cases.

entry.title: Rough solutions of a Schroedinger - Benjamin - Ono system
entry.summary: The Cauchy problem for a coupled Schroedinger and Benjamin - Ono system is shown to be globally well-posed for a class of data without finite energy. The proof uses the I-method introduced by Colliander, Keel, Staffilani, Takaoka, and Tao.

entry.title: Low Mach number flows, and combustion
entry.summary: We prove uniform existence results for the full Navier-Stokes equations for time intervals which are independent of the Mach number, the Reynolds number and the P\'eclet number. We consider general equations of state and we give an application for the low Mach number limit combustion problem introduced by Majda.

entry.title: The Cauchy problem for Schrodinger flows into Kahler manifolds
entry.summary: This paper has been withdrawn by the authors.

entry.title: Parabolic and elliptic equations with VMO coefficients
entry.summary: An $L_{p}$-theory of divergence and non-divergence form elliptic and parabolic equations is presented. The main coefficients are supposed to belong to the class $VMO_{x}$, which, in particular, contains all functions independent of $x$. Weak uniqueness of the martingale problem associated with such equations is obtained.

entry.title: Strichartz Inequalities for Lipschitz Metrics on Manifolds and Nonlinear Schrodinger Equation on Domains
entry.summary: We prove wellposedness of the Cauchy problem for the nonlinear Schrodinger equation for any defocusing power nonlinearity on a domain of the plane with Dirichlet boundary conditions. The main argument is based on a generalized Strichartz inequality on manifolds with Lipschitz metric.

entry.title: Well-posedness in H^1 for the (generalized) Benjamin-Ono equation on the circle
entry.summary: We prove the local well posedness of the Benjamin-Ono equation and the generalized Benjamin-Ono equation in $ H^1(\T) $. This leads to a global well-posedness result in $ H^1(\T)$ for the Benjamin-Ono equation.

entry.title: On the backward uniqueness property for a class of parabolic operators
entry.summary: We give sharp regularity conditions, ensuring the backward uniquess property to a class of parabolic operators.
entry.arxiv:comment: 10 pages; to appear in "Phase Space Analysis of PDE's. Proceedings of the Workshop held in Pienza (Italy), November 8-13, 2005"

entry.title: Scattering and small data completeness for the critical nonlinear Schroediger equation
entry.summary: We prove Asymptotic Completeness of one dimensional NLS with long range nonlinearities. We also prove existence and expansion of asymptotic solutions with large data at infinity.

entry.title: A Gevrey microlocal analysis of multi-anisotropic differential operators
entry.summary: We give a microlocal version of the theorem of iterates in multi-anisotropic Gevrey classes for multi-anisotropic hypoelliptic differential operators
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: Rend. Sem. Mat. Univ. Pol. Torino - Vol. 64 :3, p. 305-317, (2006)

entry.title: On elliptic boundary value problems of order 2m in cylindrical domain of large size
entry.summary: This paper is concerned with the convergence of the solution of general elliptic boundary value problems in cylindrical domain, when some directions of the domain go to infinity.

entry.title: Unique continuation for the Schrodinger equation with gradient vector potentials
entry.summary: We obtain unique continuation results for Schrodinger equations with time dependent gradient vector potentials. This result with an appropriate modification also yields unique continuation properties for solutions of certain nonlinear Schrodinger equations.

entry.title: Vanishing of the logarithmic trace of generalized Szegö projectors
entry.summary: We show that the logarithmic trace of generalized Szeg\"o projectors on compact contact manifolds vanishes identically.

entry.title: Global well-posedness for the critical 2D dissipative quasi-geostrophic equation
entry.summary: We give an elementary proof of the global well-posedness for the critical 2D dissipative quasi-geostrophic equation. The argument is based on a non-local maximum principle involving appropriate moduli of continuity.

entry.title: Estimates and Existence Results for a Fully Nonlinear Yamabe Problem on Manifolds with Boundary
entry.summary: This paper concerns a fully nonlinear version of the Yamabe problem on manifolds with boundary. We establish some existence results and estimates of solutions.

entry.title: Removable singularities for Hölder continuous quasiregular mappings in the plane
entry.summary: We give necessary conditions for a set E to be removable for Holder continuous quasiregular mappings in the plane. We also obtain some removability results for Holder continuous mappings of finite distortion.

entry.title: Some special solutions of the Schroedinger equation
entry.summary: We describe a certain "self-similar" family of solutions to the free Schroedinger equation in all dimensions, and derive some consequences of such solutions for two specific problems.

entry.title: Inégalités de Harnack et Phénomène de Concentration
entry.summary: We proove some inequalities concerning the product, sup * inf for some elliptic operators of order 2 and 4. Using those inequalities and the concentration phenomena we can describe the asymptotic behavior of those PDE solutions.

entry.title: New Symmetry Groups for Generalized Solutions of ODEs
entry.summary: It is shown for a simple ODE that it has many symmetry groups beyond its usual Lie group symmetries, when its generalized solutions are considered within the nowhere dense differential algebra of generalized functions.

entry.title: Complex-valued solutions of the Benjamin-Ono equation
entry.summary: We prove that the Benjamin-Ono initial-value problem is locally well-posed for small, complex-valued data in Sobolev spaces with special low-frequency structure.

author.name: Alexandru D. Ionescu Carlos E. Kenig

entry.title: Low-regularity Schrödinger maps, II: global well-posedness in dimensions $d\geq 3$
entry.summary: In dimensions greater than or equal to 3, we prove that the Schroedinger map initial-value problem is globally well-posed for small data in the critical Besov space.

author.name: Alexandru D. Ionescu Carlos E. Kenig

entry.title: sup+inf for Riemannian surfaces and sup*inf for for bounded domains of R^n, n>2
entry.summary: This paper is in relation with a Note of "Comptes Rendus de l'Academie des Sciences" 2005. We have an idea about a lower bounds of sup+inf (2 dimensions) and sup*inf (dimensions >2).

entry.title: Perturbation from symmetry and multiplicity of solutions for strongly indefinite elliptic systems
entry.summary: In this paper we approach the problem of perturbation from symmetry of strongly indefinite elliptic systems in dimension N>=3. We prove the existence of infinitely many solutions under suitable growth coinditions on the nonlinear terms.

entry.title: Finite Difference Schemes as a Matrix Equation
entry.summary: Finite difference schemes are here solved by means of a linear matrix equation. The theoretical study of the related algebraic system is exposed, and enables us to minimize the error due to a finite difference approximation.

entry.title: Single--peaks for a magnetic Schrödinger equation with critic al growth
entry.summary: We prove existence results of complex-valued solutions for a semilinear Schr\"odinger equation with critical growth under the perturbation of an external electromagnetic field. Solutions are found via an abstract perturbation result in critical point theory.

entry.title: Effet d'une perturbation non lineaire sur l'obtention d'une Estimation Uniforme
entry.summary: To have an uniform estimate for the solutions of the scalar curvature equation perturbed by a non linear term, we give some minimal condition on the scalar curvature.

entry.title: Extensions of Hardy inequality
entry.summary: In this paper we prove sharp Hardy inequalities by using Maximal function theory. Our results improve and extend the well-known results of G.Hardy \cite{Ha04}, T.Cazenave \cite {Ca03}, J.-Y.Chemin\cite {Ch06} and T.Tao\cite {TT06}.

entry.title: Weighted inequalities and Stein-Weiss potentials
entry.summary: Sharp extensions of Pitt's inequality and bounds for Stein-Weiss fractional integrals are obtained that incorporate gradient forms and vector-valued operators. Such results include Hardy-Rellich inequalities.
entry.arxiv:comment: version 2, corrected misprint (4 January 2007); AMSLaTeX, 13 pages

entry.title: Global well-posedness for the 2 D quasi-geostrophic equation in a critical Besov space
entry.summary: We show that the the 2 D quasi-geostrophic equation has global and unique strong solution, when the (large) data belongs in the critical, scale invariant space $\dot{B}^{2-2\al}_{2, \infty}\cap L^{2/(2\al-1)}$.

entry.title: Two remarks on solutions of Gross-Pitaevskii equations on Zhidkov spaces
entry.summary: We consider the so-called Gross-Pitaevskii equations supplemented with non-standard boundary conditions. We prove two mathematical results concerned with the initial value problem for these equations in Zhidkov spaces.

entry.title: Estimates of suitable weak solutions to the Navier-Stokes equations in critical Morrey spaces
entry.summary: We prove some estimates for suitable weak solutions to the non-stationary three-dimensional Navier-Stokes equations under assumptions that certain invariant functionals of the velocity are bounded.

entry.title: Formal Adjoints and a Canonical Form for Linear Operators
entry.summary: We describe a canonical form for linear differential operators that are formally self-adjoint or formally skew-adjoint.

entry.title: Spurious solitons and structural stability of finite difference schemes for nonlinear wave equations
entry.summary: The goal of this work is to determine classes of traveling Solitary wave solutions for a differential approximation of a finite difference scheme by means of a hyperbolic ansatz.

entry.title: A Note On 3Solitary Wave Solutions of the Compound Burgers-Korteweg-de Vries Equation"
entry.summary: The goal of this note is to construct a class of traveling solitary wave solutions for the compound Burgers-Korteweg-de Vries equation by means of a hyperbolic ansatz.

entry.title: A Uniform Estimate for Scalar Curvature Equation on Manifolds of dimension 4
entry.summary: On Riemannian manifolds of dimension 4, for prescribed scalar curvature equation, under lipschitzian condition on the prescribed curvature, we have an uniform estimate for the solutions of the equation if we control their minimas.

entry.title: A note on H-convergence
entry.summary: We give a criterion for H-convergence of conductivity matrices in terms of ordinary weak convergence of the factors in certain quotient representations of the matrices.

entry.title: Analyzability in the context of PDEs and applications
entry.summary: We discuss the notions of resurgence, formalizability, and formation of singularities in the context of partial differential equations. The results show that Ecalle's how analyzability theory extends naturally to PDEs.
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: Annales Fac. Sci. Toulouse, V XIII, Fasc. 4, pp.539--549 (2004)

entry.title: Stochastic Lagrangian Transport and Generalized Relative Entropies
entry.summary: We discuss stochastic representations of advection diffusion equations with variable diffusivity, stochastic integrals of motion and generalized relative entropies.

entry.title: The structure of the free boundary for lower dimensional obstacle problems
entry.summary: We study the regularity of the "free surface" in boundary obstacle problems. We show that near a non-degenerate point the free boundary is a $C^{1,\alpha}$ $(n-2)$-dimensional surface in $\real^{n-1}$.

entry.title: Hypocoercivity
entry.summary: This memoir attempts at a systematic study of convergence to stationary state for certain classes of degenerate diffusive equations, by means of well-chosen Lyapunov functionals. Typical examples are the kinetic Fokker--Planck and Boltzmann equation. Many open problems and possible directions for future research are discussed.

entry.title: On the Local Smoothing for the Schroedinger Equation
entry.summary: We prove a family of identities that involve the solutions to the free Schreodinger equation. As a consequence of these identities we shall deduce a lower bound for the local smoothing estimate and a uniqueness criterion.

entry.title: On the Local Smoothing for a class of conformally invariant Schroedinger equations
entry.summary: We present some a - priori bounds from above and from below for solutions to a class of conformally invariant Schroedinger equations. As a by - product we deduce some new uniqueness results.

entry.title: Damping estimates for oscillatory integral operators with finite type singularities
entry.summary: We derive damping estimates and asymptotics of $L^p$ operator norms for oscillatory integral operators with finite type singularities. The methods are based on incorporating finite type conditions into $L^2$ almost orthogonality technique of Cotlar-Stein.

entry.title: Asymptotic stability of small solitons for 2D Nonlinear Schrödinger equations with potential
entry.summary: We consider asymptotic stability of a small solitary wave to supercritical 2-dimensional nonlinear Schr\"{o}dinger equations $$ iu_t+\Delta u=Vu\pm |u|^{p-1}u \quad\text{for $(x,t)\in\mathbb{R}^2\times\mathbb{R}$,}$$ in the energy class.

entry.title: Gaussian heat kernel upper bounds via Phragmén-Lindelöf theorem
entry.summary: We prove that in presence of $L^2$ Gaussian estimates, so-called Davies-Gaffney estimates, on-diagonal upper bounds imply precise off-diagonal Gaussian upper bounds for the kernels of analytic families of operators on metric measure spaces.

entry.title: On Strichartz estimates for Schrödinger operators in compact manifolds with boundary
entry.summary: We prove local Strichartz estimates on compact manifolds with boundary. Our results also apply more generally to compact manifolds with Lipschitz metrics.

entry.title: On Decay of Solutions to Nonlinear Scrödinger Equations
entry.summary: We present general results on exponential decay of finite energy solutions to stationary nonlinear Schr\"odinger equations.

entry.title: Classes of Measures Generated by Capacities
entry.summary: We introduce classes of measures in the half-space $\mathbf{R}^{n+1}_+,$ generated by Riesz, or Bessel, or Besov capacities in $\mathbf{R}^n$, and give a geometric characterization as Carleson-type measures.

entry.title: Remark on the Kato smoothing effect for Schrödinger equation with superquadratic potentials
entry.summary: The aim of this note is to extend recent results of Yajima-Zhang \cite{Y-Z1, Y-Z2} on the 1/2- smoothing effect for Schr\"odinger equation with potential growing at infinity faster than quadratically.

entry.title: Existence and continuation of solutions for a nonlinear Neumann problem
entry.summary: In this article we study the existence, continuation and bifurcation from infinity of nonconstant solutions for a nonlinear Neumann problem. We apply the Leray-Schauder degree and the degree for SO(2)-equivariant gradient operators defined by the second author.

entry.title: The Structure of Operators on Manifolds with Polyhedral Singularities
entry.summary: We discuss intuitive ideas and historical background of concepts in the analysis on configurations with singularities, here in connection with our iterative approach for higher singularities.

entry.title: Analytic regularity of a free boundary problem
entry.summary: In this paper, we consider a free boundary problem with volume constraint. We show that positive minimizer is locally Lipschitz and the free boundary is analytic away from a singular set with Hausdorff dimension at most $n-8$.

entry.title: Boundedness of the Hessian of a biharmonic function in a convex domain
entry.summary: We consider the Dirichlet problem for the biharmonic equation on an arbitrary convex domain and prove that the second derivatives of the variational solution are bounded in all dimensions.

entry.title: The Kato smoothing effect for Schr{ö}dinger equations with unbounded potentials in exterior domains
entry.summary: In this paper we prove the smoothing effect for solutions of Schr{\"o}dinger equations with variable coefficients and in a non trapping exterior domain. We allow quadratic potentials at infinity.

entry.title: Peano type theorem for abstract parabolic equations
entry.summary: We consider parabolic problems with non-Lipschitz nonlinearity in the different scales of Banach spaces and prove local-in-time existence theorem. New class of parabolic equations that have analytic solutions is obtained.

entry.title: Doubling Properties of Caloric Functions
entry.summary: We prove local quantitative estimates of unique continuation for solutions to parabolic equations: doubling properties and two-sphere one-cylinder inequalities.

entry.title: Regularity criteria in weak spaces for Navier-Stokes equations in R3
entry.summary: In this paper we establish a Serrin type regularity criterion on the gradient of pressure in weak spaces for the Leray-Hopf weak solutions of the Navier-Stokes equations in R3.

entry.title: On the Dirichlet problem of Landau-Lifshitz-Maxwell equations
entry.summary: We prove the existence and uniqueness of non-trivial stable solutions to Landau-Lifshitz-Maxwell equations with Dirichlet boundary condition for large anisotropies and small domains, where the domains are non-simply connected.

entry.title: The Lagrange inversion theorem in the smooth case
entry.summary: The authors study the classical Lagrange inversion theorem--an antecedent of the modern implicit function theorem--in the smooth case. Examples are given to show that the result is sharp.

entry.title: Mountain pass solutions for a mean field equation from two-dimensional turbulence
entry.summary: Using Struwe's "monotonicity trick" and the recent blow-up analysis of Ohtsuka and Suzuki, we prove the existence of mountain pass solutions to a mean field equation arising in two-dimensional turbulence.

entry.title: Entire spacelike hypersurfaces of constant Gauss curvature in Minkowski space
entry.summary: We prove existence and stability of smooth entire strictly convex spacelike hypersurfaces of prescribed Gauss curvature in Minkowski space. The proof is based on barrier constructions and local a priori estimates.

entry.title: Propagation of singularities for the wave equation on edge manifolds
entry.summary: In this paper, we investigate the geometric propagation and diffraction of singularities of solutions to the wave equation on manifolds with edge singularities.

entry.title: Delta shock wave formation in the case of triangular hyperbolic system of conservation laws
entry.summary: We describe $\delta$ shock wave arising from continuous initial data in the case of triangular conservation law system arising from "generalized pressureless gas dynamics model". We use the weak asymptotic method.

entry.title: Existence and regularity of monotone solutions to a free boundary problem
entry.summary: We investigate existence and regularity properties of one-phase free boundary graphs, in connection with the question of whether there exists a complete non-planar free boundary graph in high dimensions.

entry.title: mu-Stability of 2-immersions of prescribed mean curvature and flat normal bundle in Euclidean spaces of higher codimension
entry.summary: We present three ways to establish general stability inequalities for various classes of 2-immersions in Euclidean spaces of higher codimension

entry.title: Spatially Inhomogeneous Bernstein's Problem and De Giorgi's Conjecture
entry.summary: In this note, we propose Bernstein's problem and De Giorgi's conjecture for spatially inhomogeneous equations, as well as De Giorgi's conjecture for system of reaction-diffusion equations.

entry.title: Improved Hardy and Rellich inequalities on Riemannian manifolds
entry.summary: In this paper we establish improved Hardy and Rellich type inequalities on Riemannian manifold $M$. Furthermore, we also obtain sharp constant for the improved Hardy inequality and explicit constant for the Rellich inequality on hyperbolic space $\mathbb{H}^n$.

entry.title: Weak uniqueness and partial regularity for the composite membrane problem
entry.summary: We establish a generic weak uniqueness result and partial regularity of the free boundary and of minimizers for the composite membrane problem.

entry.title: Determining the anisotropic traction state in a membrane by boundary measurements
entry.summary: We prove uniqueness and stability for an inverse boundary problem associated to an anisotropic elliptic equation arising in the modeling of prestressed elastic membranes.

entry.title: Orbital stability of standing wave solution for a quasilinear Schrödinger equation
entry.summary: Via minimization arguments and Concentration Compactness Principle, we prove the orbital stability of standing wave solutions for a class of quasilinear Schr\"{o}dinger equation arising from physics.

entry.title: On the global well-posedness of the critical quasi-geostrophic equation
entry.summary: We prove the global well-posedness of the critical dissipative quasi-geostrophic equation for large initial data belonging to the critical Besov space $\dot B^0_{\infty,1}(\RR^2).$

entry.title: Calibrations associated to Monge-Ampere equations
entry.summary: We show the volume maximizing property of the special Lagrangian submanifolds of a pseudo-Euclidean space. These special Lagrangian submanifolds arise locally as gradient graphs of solutions to Monge-Ampere Equations.

entry.title: Sharp exponential integrability for traces of monotone Sobolev functions
entry.summary: We use geometric methods to obtain a sharp exponential integrability result for boundary traces of monotone Sobolev functions defined on the unit ball.

entry.title: Local derivative estimates for heat equations on Riemannian manifolds
entry.summary: In this short note we present local derivative estimates for heat equations on Riemannian manifolds following the line of W.-X. Shi. As an application we generalize a second derivative estimate of R. Hamilton for heat equations on compact manifolds to noncompact case.

entry.title: Comparison principle for non - cooperative elliptic systems
entry.summary: This paper presents some sufficient conditions for the validity of the comparison principle for the weak solutions of non - cooperative weakly coupled systems of elliptic second-order PDEs.

entry.title: On the global existence for the axisymmetric Euler equations
entry.summary: This paper deals with the global well-posedness of the 3D axisymmetric Euler equations for initial data lying in some critical Besov spaces

entry.title: Euler Equations of Incompressible Ideal Fluids
entry.summary: This article is a survey concerning the state-of-the-art mathematical theory of the Euler equations of incompressible homogenous ideal fluid. Emphasis is put on the different types of emerging instability, and how they may be related to the description of turbulence.

entry.title: Ground state solutions to the nonlinear Schrodinger-Maxwell equations
entry.summary: We prove the existence of ground state solutions for the nonlinear Schrodinger-Maxwell equations.

entry.title: Group Classification of Semilinear Kohn-Laplace Equations
entry.summary: We study the Lie point symmetries of semilinear Kohn-Laplace equations on the Heisenberg group H^1 and obtain a complete group classification of these equations.

entry.title: On the Analyticity of Solutions to the Navier-Stokes Equations with Fractional Dissipation
entry.summary: By using a new bilinear estimate, a pointwise estimate of the generalized Oseen kernel and an idea of fractional bootstrap, we show in this note that solutions to the Navier-Stokes equations with fractional dissipation are analytic in space variables.

entry.title: Penalization approach for mixed hyperbolic systems with constant coefficients satisfying a Uniform Lopatinski Condition
entry.summary: In this paper, we describe a new, systematic and explicit way of approximating solutions of mixed hyperbolic systems with constant coefficients satisfying a Uniform Lopatinski Condition via different Penalization approaches.

entry.title: Carleman estimates and unique continuation for second order parabolic equations with nonsmooth coefficients
entry.summary: This work is devoted to the strong unique continuation problem for second order parabolic equations with nonsmooth coefficients. Introduction and bibliography have been revised.

entry.title: Energy Functionals for the Parabolic Monge-Ampere Equation
entry.summary: We introduce certain energy functionals to the complex Monge-Ampere equation over a bounded domain with inhomogeneous boundary condition, and use these functionals to show the convergence of the solution to the parabolic Monge-Ampere equation.

entry.title: Solutions fortes de l'équation de l'énergie
entry.summary: In this paper, we give some existence results of stong solutions for the energy equation associated to the Navier-Stokes equations with nonhomogeneous boundary conditions in two dimension.

entry.title: Sharp $L^1$ estimates for singular transport equations
entry.summary: We provide $L^1$ estimates for a class of transport equations containing singular integral operators. While our main application is for a specific problem in General Relativity we believe that the phenomenon which our result illustrates is of a more general interest.

entry.title: On the Motion of Vortex Sheets with Surface Tension in the 3D Euler Equations with Vorticity
entry.summary: We prove well-posedness of vortex sheets with surface tension in the 3D incompressible Euler equations with vorticity.

entry.title: Selfsimilar Equivalence of Porous Medium and p-Laplacian Flows
entry.summary: We demonstrate the equivalence between the two popular models of nonlinear diffusion, the porous medium equation and the p-Laplacian equation. The equivalence is shown at the level of selfsimilar solutions.

entry.title: Global well-posedness of the KP-I initial-value problem in the energy space
entry.summary: We prove that the KP-I initial value problem is globally well-posed in the natural energy space of the equation.

entry.title: The rectifiability of singular sets for geometric flows (I)--Yang-Mills flow
entry.summary: We prove that monotonicity of density and energy inequality imply the rectifiability of the singular sets for Yang-Mills flow.

entry.title: A Liouville type theorem for special Lagrangian Equations with constraints
entry.summary: We derive a Liouville type result for special Lagrangian equations with certain "convexity" and restricted linear growth assumptions on the solutions.
entry.arxiv:comment: 11 pages. Version to appear in CPDE

entry.title: Ground state solutions for the nonlinear Schrodinger-Maxwell equations with a singular potential
entry.summary: We prove the existence of ground state solutions for the nonlinear Schrodinger-Maxwell equations with a singular potential.

entry.title: On the stabilization of the elasticity system by the boundary
entry.summary: We obtain free of resonances regions for the elasticity system in the exterior of a strictly convex body with dissipative boundary conditions under some natural assumptions on the behaviour of the geodesics on the boundary.

entry.title: Incompressible, quasi-rigid deformations of 2-dimensional domains
entry.summary: his paper proposes a sensible definition of a deformation metric between 2-dimensional surfaces obtained from each other by an area preserving (incompressible) mapping, and an algorithm for obtaining this metric, as well as the optimal deformation.

entry.title: Multiplicity of solutions of a zero mass nonlinear equation on a Riemannian manifold
entry.summary: The relation between the number of solutions of a nonlinear equation on a Riemannian manifold and the topology of the manifold itself is studied. The technique is based on Ljusternik-Schnirelmann category and Morse theory.

entry.title: Gagliardo-Nirenberg inequalities on manifolds
entry.summary: We prove Gagliardo-Nirenberg inequalities on some classes of manifolds, Lie groups and graphs.

entry.title: High frequency dispersive estimates in dimension two
entry.summary: We prove dispersive estimates at high frequency in dimension two for both the wave and the Schrodinger groupes for a very large class of real-valued potentials.

entry.title: A Recurrence Theorem on the Solutions to the 2D Euler Equation
entry.summary: In this article, I will prove a recurrence theorem which says that any $H^s(\mathbb{T}^2)$ (s>2) solution to the 2D Euler equation returns repeatedly to an arbitrarily small $H^0(\mathbb{T}^2)$ neighborhood.

entry.title: Separable solutions of some quasilinear equations with source reaction
entry.summary: We study the existence of singular separable solutions to a class of quasilinear equations with reaction term. In the 2-dim case, we use a dynamical system approach to construct our solutions.

entry.title: Explicit gradient estimates for minimal Lagrangian surfaces of dimension two
entry.summary: We derive explicit, uniform, a priori interior Hessian and gradient estimates for special Lagrangian equations of all phases in dimension two.

entry.title: On the Cauchy problem for higher-order nonlinear dispersive equations
entry.summary: We study a class of higher-order KdV equations. We show that the associated initial value problem is well posed in weighted Besov and Sobolev spaces for small initial data. We also prove ill-posedness results when in H^s(\R), for any real s.

entry.title: Sharp Spectral Asymptotics for Dirac Energy
entry.summary: I derive sharp semiclassical asymptotics of $\int |e_h(x,y,0)|^2\omega(x,y) dx dy$ where $e_h(x,y,\tau)$ is the Schwartz kernel of the spectral projector and $\omega(x,y)$ is singular as $x=y$. I also consider asymptotics of more general expressions.

entry.title: Characterizations of Sobolev inequalities on metric spaces
entry.summary: We present isocapacitary characterizations of Sobolev inequalities in very general metric measure spaces.

entry.title: Geometrical embeddings for distributions into algebras of generalized functions
entry.summary: We use spectral theory to produce embeddings of distributions in the algebras of generalized functions on a closed Riemannian manifold. These embeddings are invariant under isometries and preserve the singularity structure of the distributions.

entry.title: A Support Theorem For The Radiation Fields On Asymptotically Euclidean Manifolds
entry.summary: We prove a support theorem for the radiation fields on asymptotically Euclidean manifolds with metrics which are warped products near infinity. It generalizes to this setting the well known support theorem for the Radon transform on n-dimensional Euclidean space.

entry.title: Capacitary estimates of solutions of semilinear parabolic equations
entry.summary: We prove an almoste representation formula for positive solutions of semilinear heat equations with power-type absorption the initial trace of which is the indicatrix function of a compact set. The representations involves a Wiener test via Bessel capacities.

entry.title: Convexity properties of solutions to the free Schrödinger equation with Gaussian decay
entry.summary: We study convexity properties of solutions to the free Schrodinger equation with Gaussian decay.

entry.title: Separable p-harmonic functions in a cone and related quasilinear equations on manifolds
entry.summary: In considering a class of quasilinear elliptic equations on a Riemannian manifold with nonnegative Ricci curvature, we give a new proof of Tolksdorf's result on the construction of separable $p$-harmonic functions in a cone.

entry.title: A sharp inequality and its applications
entry.summary: We establish an analog Hardy inequality with sharp constant involving exponential weight function. The special case of this inequality (for n=2) leads to a direct proof of Onofri inequality on S^2.

entry.title: Ahlfors theorems for differential forms
entry.summary: Some counterparts of theorems of Phragm\'en-Lindel\"of and of Ahlfors are proved for differential forms of ${\cal WT}$--classes.}

entry.title: On the large-distance asymptotics of steady state solutions of the Navier-Stokes equations in 3D exterior domains
entry.summary: We identify the leading term describing the behavior at large distances of the steady state solutions of the Navier-Stokes equations in 3D exterior domains with vanishing velocity at the spatial infinity.

entry.title: Global regularity for the 3D Navier-Stokes and the 3D Euler equations
entry.summary: The article `Global regularity for the 3D Navier-Stokes and the 3D Euler equations'(arXiv:0711.2453) is withdrawn due to a serious error in the proof.

entry.title: On the global well-posedness of the Boussinesq system with zero viscosity
entry.summary: In this paper we prove the global well-posedness of the two-dimensional Boussinesq system with zero viscosity for rough initial data.

entry.title: On the a priori estimates for the Euler, the Navier-Stokes and the quasi-geostrophic equations
entry.summary: We prove new \emph{a priori} estimates for the 3D Euler, the 3D Navier-Stokes and the 2D quasi-geostrophic equations by the method of similarity transforms.

entry.title: Semi-classical calculus on manifolds with ends and weighted Lp estimates
entry.summary: For a class of non compact Riemannian manifolds with ends, we give pseudo-differential expansions of bounded functions of the semi-classical Laplacian and study related Lp boundedness properties.

entry.title: Littlewood-Paley decompositions on manifolds with ends
entry.summary: For certain non compact Riemannian manifolds with ends, we obtain Littlewood-Paley type estimates on (weighted) Lp spaces, using the usual square function defined by a dyadic partition.

entry.title: Strichartz estimates on asymptotically hyperbolic manifolds
entry.summary: We prove local in time Strichartz estimates without loss for the restriction of the solution of the Schroedinger equation, outside a large compact set, on a class of asymptotically hyperbolic manifolds.

entry.title: On dispersion for Klein Gordon equation with periodic potential in 1D
entry.summary: By exploiting estimates on Bloch functions obtained in a previous paper, we prove decay estimates for Klein Gordon equations with a time independent potential periodic in space in 1D and with generic mass

entry.title: Time decay for Schroedinger equation with rough potentials
entry.summary: We obtain certain time decay and regularity estimates for 3D Schroedinger equation with a potential in the Kato class by using Besov spaces associated with Schroedinger operators.

entry.title: Behavior of bounded solutions of quasilinear elliptic equations on Riemannian manifolds
entry.summary: This paper deals with bounded solutions of quasilinear elliptic equations on Riemannian manifolds satisfying special condition.

entry.title: Regularity of Leray-Hopf solutions to Navier-Stokes equations
entry.summary: Limit behaviors of blow up solutions for impressible Navier-Stokes equations are obtained.

entry.title: Strichartz estimates for Schroedinger equations with periodic potential in 1D
entry.summary: This paper has been withdrawn by the author due to a crucial error in the Proof of Theorem 0.3

entry.title: Symmetry of singular solutions of degenerate quasilinear elliptic equations
entry.summary: We prove radial symmetry of singular solutions to an overdetermined boundary value problem for a class of degenerate quasilinear elliptic equations.
entry.arxiv:comment: 8 pages, to appear on Rendiconti dell'Istituto di Matematica dell'Universita' di Trieste

entry.title: Stability in the Stefan problem with surface tension (I)
entry.summary: We develop a high-order energy method to prove asymptotic stability of flat steady surfaces for the Stefan problem with surface tension - also known as the Stefan problem with Gibbs-Thomson correction.

entry.title: Hessian and gradient estimates for three dimensional special Lagrangian Equations with large phase
entry.summary: We derive a priori interior Hessian and gradient estimates for special Lagrangian equation of phase at least a critical value in dimension three.

entry.title: A Global Uniqueness for Formally Determined Inverse Electromagnetic Obstacle Scattering
entry.summary: It is proved that a general polyhedral perfect conducting obstacle in $\mathbb{R}^3$, possibly consisting of finitely many solid polyhedra, is uniquely determined by the far-field pattern corresponding to a single incident wave. This improves earlier results in the literature to the formally determined case.

entry.title: Towards optimal DRP scheme for linear advection
entry.summary: Finite difference schemes are here solved by means of a linear matrix equation. The theoretical study of the related algebraic system is exposed, and enables us to minimize the error due to a finite difference approximation, while building a new DRP scheme in the same time.

entry.title: Continuous Dependence for Backward Parabolic Operators with Log-Lipschitz Coefficients
entry.summary: We prove continuous dependence on Cauchy data for a backward parabolic operator whose coefficients are Log-Lipschitz continuous in time.

entry.title: A note on the Compound Burgers-Korteweg-de Vries Equation with higher-order nonlinearities and its traveling solitary waves
entry.summary: In this paper, we study a compound Korteweg-de Vries-Burgers equation with a higher-order nonlinearity. A class of solitary wave solutions is obtained by means of a series expansion.
